subject: Marketing
title: The Endowment Effect
description: A quick, practical guide to The Endowment Effect.

hook.text: People given a free coffee mug demanded $7 to sell it. Buyers offered only $3.

buildup.text: Once people own something, they value it roughly twice as much as before they owned it.

discovery.text: The endowment effect explains why free trials convert so wellâ€”users feel ownership.

twist.text: Canceling a subscription feels like losing something, not just stopping a payment.

climax.text: Smart pricing strategies give customers a taste of ownership before asking them to pay.

punchline.text: Let them hold it and they won't let go.

quiz.question: What is the endowment effect in pricing psychology?
options: People value things more once they feel ownership
Expensive products are always perceived as better
Customers prefer products with generous return policies
